utterance: If black people aren't all criminals, why are they disproportionately arrested and taking up space in our prisons?
If black people aren't all criminals, why are they disproportionately arrested and taking up space in our prisons?

The real issue is institutionalised racism in the Police. This means that black people are more likely to get stopped, searched, or assumed to be doing something suspicious. Additionally, the Police tends to focus on petty crimes that are usually commited in poorer areas, where black people are more likely to live. Therefore, white collar crime isn't as well reported.
